intro: Eriocaulon parviflorum, commonly known as the small-flowered flat sedge, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, thriving in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its inflorescence consists of a dense cluster of tiny, pale green to brownish flowers. Eriocaulon parviflorum plays a role in stabilizing wetland ecosystems and is often found in temperate regions.
